title: Funerary urn of Nouia Oppia
support: The lid of a large fragmentary lekanis, with a truncated cone profile. The lekanis body is 31 cm high, 42.5cm in diameter (40 cm internal diameter). The lid is 48.5 cm in diameter.

layout.p: The text is incised, seemingly after firing, on the lower part of the main surface of the lid, over a length of 25 cm, in a single line, just below a painted red band which circles the lid.

handNote.lettering: Thinly incised letters, of wide module, with some decorative serifs (foot of upsilon and of pi), and some curving strokes (upsilon, alpha). Omicron is full size, alpha with straight bar, pi with verticals of equal length. The second iota has a small stroke across the top; the first has a small loop upper right, similar to a rho.

date._: second half of the 3rd century BCE

provenanceFound._: Excavated in 1971, found in a stone built chamber tomb in Largo Avignone, Messina
